title: The Promise of the Comforter
shortSummary: John 16 records Jesus' final teachings to His disciples before His crucifixion, focusing on the coming of the Holy Spirit, the Comforter, who will guide them into all truth. Jesus prepares His followers for the trials ahead, assuring them of joy after sorrow and peace amid tribulation through His victory over the world.
timeline: c. AD 30 - Final teachings of Jesus before His crucifixion

keyCharacters.name: Jesus Christ
keyCharacters.description: The Son of God who speaks to His disciples about His departure, the coming of the Holy Spirit, and the challenges they will face.

keyCharacters.name: The Disciples
keyCharacters.description: Followers of Jesus who receive His teaching about future persecution, the coming Comforter, and the promise of joy and peace.

keyCharacters.name: The Comforter (Holy Spirit)
keyCharacters.description: The Spirit of truth promised by Jesus to come after His departure to guide, reprove, and glorify Christ to the disciples.

definitions.definition: A title for the Holy Spirit, meaning one who consoles, guides, and empowers believers after Jesus' ascension.
To convict or convince of sin, righteousness, and judgment, as the Holy Spirit does in the world.
A Jewish place of worship and community gathering, from which believers would be expelled due to their faith in Christ.
A title referring to Satan, who is judged and defeated through Christ's work.

outline.heading: Warning of Persecution and Rejection
outline.description: Jesus warns His disciples that they will face persecution, including expulsion from synagogues and even death, because the world does not know the Father or Him. He acknowledges their sorrow but prepares them for what is to come.

outline.heading: The Promise of the Holy Spirit
outline.description: Jesus explains the necessity of His departure so that the Holy Spirit, the Comforter, can come. The Spirit will convict the world of sin, righteousness, and judgment, and will guide the disciples into all truth, glorifying Jesus.

outline.heading: Jesus’ Departure and Future Joy
outline.description: Jesus speaks of His imminent departure and return, likening the disciples’ sorrow to a woman’s labor pains that turn to joy. He assures them that their prayers in His name will be answered, leading to full joy.

outline.heading: Plain Teaching and Assurance of Faith
outline.description: Jesus shifts from speaking in proverbs to plain teaching about His divine origin and mission. He predicts the disciples’ scattering but assures them of His peace despite tribulation, affirming His victory over the world.

application: Trust in the Holy Spirit to guide you into truth and empower you in times of trial.
Remain steadfast in faith even when facing rejection or persecution for Christ’s sake.
Approach God confidently in prayer, asking in Jesus’ name to experience the fullness of joy.
Take heart in Christ’s victory over the world and let His peace guard your heart amid difficulties.

keyVerses.text: Nevertheless I tell you the truth; It is expedient for you that I go away: for if I go not away, the Comforter will not come unto you; but if I depart, I will send him unto you.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the essential role of Jesus’ departure in sending the Holy Spirit to empower believers.

keyVerses.text: Howbeit when he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he will guide you into all truth: for he shall not speak of himself; but whatsoever he shall hear, that shall he speak: and he will shew you things to come.
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes the Holy Spirit’s role as a divine guide and revealer of truth to the disciples and all believers.

keyVerses.text: And ye now therefore have sorrow: but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man taketh from you.
keyVerses.significance: This verse assures believers that temporary sorrow will be replaced by lasting joy through Christ’s resurrection and return.

keyVerses.text: These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.
keyVerses.significance: Jesus offers peace and courage to believers, affirming His victory over worldly trials and opposition.
